H0.text: Which Scottish mathematician discovered logarithms. James Gregory

H1.text: Which Scottish mathematician discovered logarithms. Colin Maclaurin

H2.text: Which Scottish mathematician discovered logarithms. John Wallis

H3.text: Which Scottish mathematician discovered logarithms. Napierian

A4.text: Napier is best known as the discoverer of logarithms.

A5.text: Napier's work Mirifici Logarithmorum Canonis Descriptio (1614) contained fifty-seven pages of explanatory matter and ninety pages of tables listing the natural logarithms of trigonometric functions.
